required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TAS1R1, TAS1R3, TLR2, TLR4, CA6 Gene Polymorphism on Dental Caries
clinical_study.official_title: TAS1R1, TAS1R3, TLR2, TLR4, CA6 Gene Polymorphism on Caries Risk in Adult

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the effects of TAS1R1, TAS1R3, TLR2, TLR4, CA6, gene polymorphism on caries risk in adults.

detailed_description.textblock:
To date, genes can be grouped into categories based on the factor influencing dental caries. The major candidate gene categories to date include enamel formation genes, immune response genes, genes related to saliva, and genes related to taste and dietary habits.
CA6 exists in the human saliva and has a critical role of buffering, immune response and taste.Toll-like receptors are expressed in the tongue gustatory papillae where they may initiate immune responses to pathogens.Genetic variations in the TAS1R1 and TAS1R3 for umami cause perception of these tastes differently.

primary_outcome.description: Each tooth will be examined and recorded as decayed, missing, or filled (DMFT). Caries will be defined in accordance with the World Health Organization (WHO 1997) criteria.

arm_group.description: 100 adults will be allowed in the high caries risk group according to DMFT index (DMFT ≥ 14)
100 adults will be allowed in the low caries risk group according to DMFT index (DMFT ≤ 5)

intervention.description: DNAs were obtained from epithelial cells in buccal mucosa and were extracted with Genomic DNA Isolation Kit Genotyping for a variant was carried out on a Roche Applied Science LightCycler® 480 (Roche Diagnostics GmbH, Mannheim, Germany) with real-time polymerase reaction of Taqman

Dental caries lesions of all patient scored as initial, moderate or advanced caries Initial lesion; clinically detectable lesion Moderate; visible signs of enamel breakdown Advanced; enamel was fully cavitaed

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA for genetic analysis was isolated from buccal epithelial cells

study_pop.textblock: Power analysis was performed with the G-Power software package. It was determined that a total of 200 patients will be needed: 100 (DMFT ≤ 5) for the low caries risk group and 100 (DMFT ≥ 14) for the high caries risk group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult be between 25 and 44 years old
- subject has DMFT (Decayed, Missing, Filled, Permanent Tooth) ≥ 5, or, DMFT ≥14
- same oral health, diet and socioeconomic status
Exclusion Criteria:
- systemic or genetic disorders
- orthodontic appliances
- pregnant women

overall_official.affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Dentistry Faculty

link.description: Gene-environment Interactions in the Etiology of Dental Caries.

reference.citation: Yildiz G, Ermis RB, Calapoglu NS, Celik EU, Türel GY. Gene-environment Interactions in the Etiology of Dental Caries. J Dent Res. 2016 Jan;95(1):74-9. doi: 10.1177/0022034515605281. Epub 2015 Sep 16.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available within 6 months of study completion
